header: ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 IN CRI. BAIL APPLICATION No. 71/2019 (Jayant Rangnath Kulkarni Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000387­2019

background.text: 1) Present application is filed by the applicant under section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 apprehending his arrest as a result of complaint dated 17.01.2019 filed by Tukaram Dhondiba Kamble suspecting applicant's involvement in the offence of pun/u/Sec. 408 of Indian Penal Code.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of criminal procedure code

arguments.text: 2) It is contended that, the accusation against the applicant is totally false, the applicant has no concern with the alleged offence, applicant was senior officer of M.S.E.B and Secretary of the credit society. Now, he is retired, entire record is in custody of Society and applicant has no concern with the same, he is innocent, applicant has strong apprehension of arrest, hence he prayed for pre­arrest bail in the matter.

argumentSentences.text: 2) It is contended that, the accusation against the applicant is totally false, the applicant has no concern with the alleged offence, applicant was senior officer of M.S.E.B and Secretary of the credit society.

Now, he is retired, entire record is in custody of Society and applicant has no concern with the same, he is innocent, applicant has strong apprehension of arrest, hence he prayed for pre­arrest bail in the matter.

arguments.text: 3) Advocate for applicant argued that, applicant is innocent, having no connection with the crime. He was retired in the year 2008, so also he was not in custody of record and assured that, he will neither tamper nor hamper with prosecution witnesses if he is released on anticipatory bail. It is also argued that, he is permanent resident of the of Satara, ready to furnish bail by way of security of his presence before police or Court as and when required.

argumentSentences.text: 3) Advocate for applicant argued that, applicant is innocent, having no connection with the crime.
He was retired in the year 2008, so also he was not in custody of record and assured that, he will neither tamper nor hamper with prosecution witnesses if he is released on anticipatory bail.
It is also argued that, he is permanent resident of the of Satara, ready to furnish bail by way of security of his presence before police or Court as and when required.

arguments.text: 4) It appears that, the applicant is retired in the year 2008, before 2008, he was the elected Secretary, therefore, cannot be held responsible for day to day transactions in society, he may not be said aware about the day to day transactions. Documents are reflecting that, in his tenure, he has made correspondence with the informant and accordingly informant has complied the correspondence. However, after compliance by the informant, it is for the office staff of concerned society to maintain the record properly.

argumentSentences.text: 4) It appears that, the applicant is retired in the year 2008, before 2008, he was the elected Secretary, therefore, cannot be held responsible for day to day transactions in society, he may not be said aware about the day to day transactions.
Documents are reflecting that, in his tenure, he has made correspondence with the informant and accordingly informant has complied the correspondence.
However, after compliance by the informant, it is for the office staff of concerned society to maintain the record properly.

arguments.text: 5] The copy of voucher is still blank of which entry is taken in daily register on 31.03.2006 page No. 147. In this circumstance, the custodial interrogation of this accused cannot be said necessary. The documents pertaining to the alleged crime can be seized from the office. Nothing is to be seized from this accused. Hence, following order.

argumentSentences.text: 5] The copy of voucher is still blank of which entry is taken in daily register on 31.03.2006 page No. 147.
In this circumstance, the custodial interrogation of this accused cannot be said necessary.
The documents pertaining to the alleged crime can be seized from the office.
Nothing is to be seized from this accused.

order.text: O R D E R 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 71of 2019 is allowed. 2) Interim pre­arrest bail order dated 01.02.2019 passed below Exh. 4, stands confirmed with conditions therein alongwith one more condition that, a) Applicant shall attend the concern police station twice in a week on every Monday and Thursday in between 11:00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till filing of charge­sheet.

footer: (B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 14th February, 2019. Satara
processedText:
ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 IN CRI. BAIL APPLICATION No. 71/2019 (Jayant Rangnath Kulkarni Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000387­2019 
---header-ends---
1) Present application is filed by the applicant under section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 apprehending his arrest as a result of complaint dated 17.01.2019 filed by Tukaram Dhondiba Kamble suspecting applicant's involvement in the offence of pun/u/Sec. 408 of Indian Penal Code. 
---background-ends---
2) It is contended that, the accusation against the applicant is totally false, the applicant has no concern with the alleged offence, applicant was senior officer of M.S.E.B and Secretary of the credit society. Now, he is retired, entire record is in custody of Society and applicant has no concern with the same, he is innocent, applicant has strong apprehension of arrest, hence he prayed for pre­arrest bail in the matter. 
---argument-ends---
3) Advocate for applicant argued that, applicant is innocent, having no connection with the crime. He was retired in the year 2008, so also he was not in custody of record and assured that, he will neither tamper nor hamper with prosecution witnesses if he is released on anticipatory bail. It is also argued that, he is permanent resident of the of Satara, ready to furnish bail by way of security of his presence before police or Court as and when required. 
---argument-ends---
4) It appears that, the applicant is retired in the year 2008, before 2008, he was the elected Secretary, therefore, cannot be held responsible for day to day transactions in society, he may not be said aware about the day to day transactions. Documents are reflecting that, in his tenure, he has made correspondence with the informant and accordingly informant has complied the correspondence. However, after compliance by the informant, it is for the office staff of concerned society to maintain the record properly. 
---argument-ends---
5] The copy of voucher is still blank of which entry is taken in daily register on 31.03.2006 page No. 147. In this circumstance, the custodial interrogation of this accused cannot be said necessary. The documents pertaining to the alleged crime can be seized from the office. Nothing is to be seized from this accused. Hence, following order. 
---argument-ends---
O R D E R 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 71of 2019 is allowed. 2) Interim pre­arrest bail order dated 01.02.2019 passed below Exh. 4, stands confirmed with conditions therein alongwith one more condition that, a) Applicant shall attend the concern police station twice in a week on every Monday and Thursday in between 11:00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till filing of charge­sheet. 
---order-ends---
(B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 14th February, 2019. Satara
